scenes.title: Three-front war, one new lever
scenes.main_point: AI raised expectations, broke distribution, and intensified competition—so growth shifted to trust.
scenes.scene_summary: AI raised expectations, collapsed channels, and intensified competition, so growth shifted to trust.
scenes.scene_prompt:
Delicate watercolor painting style, soft washes, visible brush strokes, muted tones.
A lone startup founder stands at a desk in a modern office, facing three opposing forces: a looming AI silhouette, crumbling marketing funnels, and rival teams pressing in.
They reach for a simple handshake icon labeled “trust,” determined amid mounting pressure.

scenes.title: Trust-based acquisition replaces broken channels
scenes.main_point: SEO, SEM, and corporate social weakened; trust now came from people, creators, community, and product experience.
scenes.scene_summary: SEO, SEM, and corporate social weakened; employee voices, creators, community, and product built word of mouth.
key_elements: SEO disrupted by AI answers and content slop
SEM costs rising and ROAS falling
Social platforms limiting corporate reach and links
Word of mouth as ultimate trust signal
scenes.scene_prompt:
Delicate watercolor painting style, soft washes, visible brush strokes, muted tones.
In the same war-room from scene 1, the same startup team watches cracked signposts labeled “SEO,” “SEM,” and “Corporate Social” fade into the background.
They turn toward a circle of employees, creators, and community users sharing stories and passing referrals through a small “Cello” card, hopeful and energized.

scenes.title: Trust-based retention becomes the moat
scenes.main_point: AI commoditized cheaper/faster value props; retention depended on confidence in ongoing outcomes and aligned execution.
scenes.scene_summary: AI commoditized cheaper and faster value props, so retention depended on confidence in ongoing outcomes.
key_elements: Value prop triad: cheaper, more efficient, more effective
AI outcompeting efficiency and cost claims
Commoditization pushing users toward trusted products
Trust builders: real roadmap visibility, fast feedback iteration, WOW UX
Brand as a product job; product had to be the story
Operational shift: cross-functional alignment, velocity, build in public
Closing warning: channels and value props collapsing faster than expected
scenes.scene_prompt:
Delicate watercolor painting style, soft washes, visible brush strokes, muted tones.
The same founder and small cross-functional team stand together on the familiar battlefield-map table, calmly placing a stone ring labeled “TRUST” around their product marker as cheaper/faster/easier tokens scatter away.
In the war-room setting, they pin a simple public roadmap card and a feedback note beside the marker, conveying resolved confidence and alignment.
